intro: Lychnophora humillima, commonly known as the small lychnophora, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is a shrub or small tree that typically grows up to 2 meters in height. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, followed by small, round fruits.
